intro: Echinopepon micropaniculatus, commonly known as the small-paniculate melon, is a rare and little-studied species within the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its small, hairy fruits that typically measure less than 5 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces yellow flowers with distinctive lobed petals and exhibits a climbing growth habit. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and scarcity in botanical collections, much remains to be learned about its ecology and potential uses.
